paper_abstract: The feedback number of a graph G is the minimum number of vertices whose removal from G results in an acyclic subgraph. We use f (n, k) to denote the feedback number of the (n, k)-star graph S-n,S-k and p(n, k) the number of k-permutations of an n-element set. This paper proves that p(n, k) - 2(k - 1)!((n)(k - 1)) <= integral (n, k) <= p(n, k) - 2(k - 1)!Sigma(theta)(i=1) ((n - 2i + 1)(k - i)). where theta = min{k - 1, n - k + 1}. (c) 2012 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved,
paper_title: On the bounds of feedback numbers of (n, k)-star graphs
